file_content.text: Thank you again for your help. May the Force be with you.
Were you successful, Padawan? Did you find our pupils in the ruins?
Tell us, what did you uncover about the nature of Spanios and Moracen's relationship? Are they romantically involved?
Your fears are justified, Masters. Spanios and Moracen are romantically involved.
They are lovers.
I knew it! As I said, Yollo, I'm cursed.
It seems we're both cursed, my friend. They will have to renounce their love and agree to remain apart, or they will never become Jedi.
What a waste. But you have done well, young one. I know it must not be pleasant scrutinizing your fellow Padawans.
It was a difficult assignment. I didn't enjoy spying on my fellows.
I'm conflicted about this.
We are sorry it was necessary.
All in the name of duty.
I won't do your laundry again.
Step lightly, Padawan. You are here to serve.
For your efforts in this matter, please take this as a token of commendation.
You are generous.
I did this out of sense of duty. I require no further reward, Master.
Service is my reward.
It is not given to satisfy a requirement, young one.
That's more like it. Now we're talking.
It's about time.
More Padawans could benefit from your shining example. Thank you again--and may the Force be with you.
I discovered that there is no romance between them, Masters.
They are innocent.
You see, Master Silvarte, your concerns were for naught.
I am relieved to hear this. Surprised, but most relieved.
You have handled this matter with great character. The order is fortunate to have you in the fold.
Believe me, you give me more credit than I deserve.
I did nothing special.
Humility is a virtue, young one.
I'm glad you think so, Master. Your praise means much to me.
Then I am pleased.
Your quality is clear as day, Padawan.
That's all well and good, but am I excused?
Can I go now?
I'm sorry if you feel put upon, youngster.
Now that you've befriended them, you might check in on our students. Otherwise, good luck with the rest of your training.
Youngster, we'd like an answer to our quandary as soon as possible. Please head to the ruins of Kaleth and confront our Padawans about their relationship.
I seem to be cursed. Why do I always get the pupils who think they're the exceptions to the rule?
Master Silvarte, it's true that our Padawans are acting a bit strangely, but I don't think there's cause for concern.
I cannot shake the feeling, Master Yollo. These youngsters today, they think they're invincible, and if you're above a certain age, they just disregard you.
Wait, I have an idea. You, Padawan, I know you.
I'm sorry--I don't believe we've met, Master.
How do you know me?
Thank you, I stand corrected, youngster. I only know of you.
You need me, Master?
Indeed. I've heard good things about you. I'm hoping they weren't overblown.
I'm sorry, Master, are you talking to me?
Who, me?
Yes. It's what I usually do when I wish an audience with someone.
I fathom what you have in mind, Master Silvarte. Are you certain it's necessary?
I do. Padawan, you're a rising star here. We have an unfortunate circumstance and require someone of your station to assist us.
If there's trouble, point me in the right direction. I'm ready.
I'm prepared for action.
Your blade won't be needed.
Every circumstance is an opportunity to expand my knowledge.
I learn from everything.
Very wise, young one.
I am here for you.
How refreshing.
I have to ask, do you mean to be so condescending?
That's a bit insulting.
You misread me, young one. No offense intended. Allow me to elaborate.
Master Silvarte is concerned about a couple of our Padawans. He suspects that they are, well....
Exploring a romantic entanglement--with one another.
If I am correct, they are following their passions down a dark path.
I certainly understand your concern.
Sounds like trouble.
Indeed, this is nothing to take lightly.
Tell me your need.
Am I to understand that love leads to the dark side?
So, romance is bad?
Emotions disrupt balance. When you hold one person in higher regard than others, it clouds clarity and twists reason. We mustn't stand by.
In all other aspects, these two are model pupils. But I agree we would be remiss if we didn't do what we can to settle the issue.
They may be more open and revealing with a student like you. We need you to confront them and discover if they are indeed cultivating a romance.
If they're breaking the Jedi Code, I promise you--I will find out.
I'll take this seriously.
Right away.
I'm basically to become a glorified snoop, then.
Spying on other Padawans?
You are helping the order root out the seeds of darkness. There is no task more important.
Their names are Moracen and Spanios. As we speak, they are in the ruins of Lower Kaleth.
So go, talk with them and report back what you discover about their relationship.
Try not to alert or alarm them. If they are in love, they are sure to be volatile.
Do not pause here. Master Yollo and I are having a private conversation.
